CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of storing and transporting drugs and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The applicant started serving his sentence in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE granted the applicant ’s request to be transferred to GPE , his country of citizenship and his mother ’s place of residence , to serve the rest of his sentence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s request to be transferred to GPE was granted by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following an agreement between the NORP and NORP authorities , the applicant was transferred to GPE .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s request for supervisory review of his case , the Presidium of the YuzhnoKazakhstanskiy Regional Court , in its decision of DATE , varied the judgment of CARDINAL DATE by reclassifying the offence and reducing the sentence . In the same decision the court applied the DATE LAW , discharged the applicant from serving the remainder of his sentence and ordered as follows :
“ The convicted prisoner PERSON is to be released from custody forthwith . ”

CARDINAL . DATE ORG sent a copy of its decision to the NORP regional prosecutor ’s office , which received it on DATE and , since no information about the place where the applicant was serving his sentence had yet been received from the NORP authorities , launched an inquiry about his location .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant arrived at correctional facility no . CARDINAL ( penitentiary establishment GPE ) in ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE , immediately after he had learned of the court decision of DATE , he notified it to the administration of his correctional facility and requested them to expedite his release .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after having established the applicant ’s location , the YuzhnoKazakhstanskiy regional prosecutor ’s office sent a copy of the YuzhnoKazakhstanskiy ORG decision of DATE to GPE . According to the Government , the decision was sent to ORG of ORG . According to the applicant , it was sent to ORG correctional facility no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , a copy of ORG decision of DATE was received by ORG of ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , which was located in ORG , after having established the applicant ’s location , forwarded the decision to ORG correctional facility no . CARDINAL , which received it on CARDINAL DATE and forwarded it on DATE to ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . The Prosecutor General ’s Office received the decision on DATE . On DATE a deputy Prosecutor General ordered that the applicant be discharged from serving the remainder of his sentence . DATE , the prosecutor ’s decision was sent to ORG of GPE for execution . On DATE it was received by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s decision reached correctional facility no . CARDINAL and the applicant was released on DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant brought proceedings against ORG of GPE and ORG of GPE seeking compensation in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage sustained as a result of his allegedly unlawful and unfounded detention for DATE after the decision of ORG . By a judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE the applicant ’s action was dismissed . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment on appeal and remitted the case to the first - instance court for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE examined the case anew . It established what the NORP authorities had done in respect of the YuzhnoKazakhstanskiy ORG decision . In particular , it noted that the decision had been received by correctional facility no . CARDINAL from ORG on DATE . It found that ORG on ORG Serving of their Sentences was not applicable to the applicant ’s case as it had not come into force in respect of GPE at the relevant time . It held that ORG had issued the order for the applicant ’s release on DATE by virtue of its competence and relevant regulations , notably the decree of the Presidium of ORG DATE on the Procedure for Execution of Obligations arising for the GPE from ORG in a State of their LAW , signed in GPE on DATE , and instructions of DATE on enforcement of that decree . The court stated that the decision of ORG discharging the applicant from serving the remainder of his sentence had been lawful . It held that there had been no fault on the part of the defendant authorities and that therefore there was no basis to grant the applicant ’s claim for compensation in respect of non - pecuniary damage . Nor did it find grounds for granting the applicant ’s claim for compensation in respect of pecuniary damage based on the loss of employment income . It noted that the applicant , who had been employed DATE after his release , had failed to prove that he had been unable to find employment earlier through the fault of the defendant authorities . In rejecting the applicant ’s claims the court relied on Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . It noted , in particular , that ORG had established no unjustified delay on the part of the defendant authorities in executing the NORP court decision . There had thus been no fault on the part of the authorities , and the applicant ’s claims had been rightly dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application for supervisory review of the case . On CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected his application .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW , the generally recognised principles and norms of international law and international agreements form part of GPE ’s legal order . International agreements prevail over national statutes in the event of conflict .
CARDINAL . The Civil Code of GPE contains the following provisions on liability for damage caused by ORG bodies .

A court may award compensation for non - pecuniary damage ( physical or mental suffering ) to a person who sustained such damage as a result of a violation of his or her personal non - pecuniary rights . In order to determine the amount of compensation for non - pecuniary damage the court must have regard to the extent to which the perpetrator was at fault and the intensity of any mental anguish or physical suffering caused , bearing in mind the individual characteristics of the victim ( LAW ) .

“ Damage caused to an individual or a legal entity as a result of an unlawful act ( failure to act ) of ORG bodies , local self - government bodies or of their officials , including as a result of the issuance of an act of a ORG or self - government body which is contrary to the law or any other legal act , shall be subject to compensation . The damage shall be compensated for at the expense , respectively , of the treasury of GPE , the treasury of the subject of GPE or the treasury of the municipal authority . ”

“ CARDINAL . Damage caused to an individual as a result of his or her wrongful conviction or unlawful criminal prosecution , or the unlawful application , as a measure of restraint , of remand in custody or of a written undertaking not to leave a specified place , or the unlawful imposition of an administrative penalty in the form of arrest or corrective labour , shall be compensated for in full at the expense of the treasury of GPE and in certain cases , stipulated by law , at the expense of the treasury of the subject of GPE or of the municipal authority , regardless of the fault of the officials of agencies of inquiry or preliminary investigation , prosecutor ’s offices or courts in the procedure established by law .

CARDINAL . Damage caused to an individual or a legal entity as a result of the unlawful activity of agencies of inquiry or preliminary investigation or prosecutor ’s offices , which has not entailed the consequences specified in paragraph CARDINAL of this Article , shall be compensated for on the grounds and according to the procedure provided for by LAW ... ”

Article CARDINAL of LAW authorises certain ORG financial authorities to act on behalf of the respective treasury in cases where the ORG has been found liable for damages . Article CARDINAL of the Civil Code states , in particular , that non - pecuniary damage shall be compensated for irrespective of any award for pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ( signed in GPE on DATE , entered into force on DATE in respect of GPE and on DATE in respect of GPE ) , if an authority which receives another contracting ORG ’s request for legal assistance is not competent to deal with the request , it has to forward the request to the relevant competent authority . An authority which executes such a request normally has to apply the legislation of its own country .

CARDINAL . Under Government Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , in force at the material time , the ORG ’s mail was to be delivered with priority . Under Government Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , in force at the material time , the ORG ’s mail was to be delivered on DATE of its arrival throughout DATE in question . The statutory time - limit for the postal delivery of normal letters between GPE and ORG was DATE .
